dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Dalrymple b Mahmood 120 (156b 14x4 0x6 221m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: short ball, pitched outside the off stump and cutting in, Tharanga goes for the pull and once fails to connect properly, ball clips the top-edge and lobs up towards midwicket, easy catch held and a massive innings come to an end

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Strauss b Collingwood 24 (36b 0x4 1x6 70m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Two down! slower delivcery on the middle and leg stump, Jayawardene picks it up and tries to loft over the fielder at mid-off, completely mistimes it and ends up hitting in the air, simple catch to Strauss at mid-off, excellent change of pace from Collingwood does the trick!

dismissalComment.html: Excellent catch! short ball outside off stump, nipping in a bit, Dilshan picks up the length quickly and cuts hard but fails to keep it down, Collingwood at backward point dives to his right and takes a stunner

dismissalText.commentary: Jamie Dalrymple b Muralidaran 67 (87b 5x4 0x6 109m) SR: 77.01

dismissalComment.html: England's slump continues! flatter trajectory, pitched outside the off stump and turning in, Dalrymple goes down on one knee in an attempt to slog it over the midwicket fence but is bit early into the shot and the ball crashes into the stumps, the ball nicely gripped the surface and turned in slowly and Dalrymple was beaten by the lack of pace there , end of a good innings from the debutant

commentTextItems.html: full and on the stumps, no room offered and Plunkett is made to drive straight, just a single down to long-on

commentPostTextItems.html: England would have fancied their chances chasing 258 but what the England bowlers lacked the Lankans had in abundance, they bowled with discipline and control, they struck at regular intervals and under the burden of reality, one after the other the England batsmen simply wilted away into oblivion.

Apart from Trescothick and Dalrymple all the other batsmen looked like strangers in an alien land,  Jayawardene played his cards beautifully and his proactive approach did wonders for the Lankan cause and in the end it was a deserving win for the visitors. Just for the record Sri Lanka now lead the 5-match series 1-0.

Second match of the series will be played at The Oval, London on the 20th of June, we will be on live as and when the first ball is bowled - be sure to join us then. For the time being though this is Sajan Nair along with Gautham signing off, Good bye and good luck.

commentTextItems.html: good length delivery, straight and on the stumps, Harmison makes room and lofts it away to deep cover
way outside the off stump and that's rightly called a wide
fulltoss on the pads, Plunkett looking to flick it away on the leg side failes to connect and the ball rolls away off the pad
again driven down to long-on, the writing is on the wall I guess
good length delivery, Malinga keeping it wicket to wicket, Harmison gets behind the line and punches it down to long-on, runs hard and comes back for the second
driven down to long-on, just a single
driven to long-off, another single added to the total

headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

commentTextItems.html: short of a good length delivery, this one nipped back in shaprly, Plunkett once again goes for the pull, probably looking to clear the midwicket fence but on this occasion he failed to make contact and the ball went through to the keeper
fulltoss outside the off stump, driven down to long-off for a single
good length delivery on the middle and off stump line, driven straight to Murali at midwicket - just a single there
good length delivery outside the off stump, Plunkett drives off the back-foot and the ball flies over the fielder at point, there was a run out in the offing but the Lankans failed to capatilise.
short of a good length delivery, angled in from wide of the crease, Plunkett pulls and pulls well - ball flies away to the midwicket fence - keep them coming!
full and speared in on the stumps, a well bowled yorker, Harmison somehow manages to dig it out

dismissalText.commentary: Sajid Mahmood b Malinga 8 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 114.28

commentTextItems.html: good length delivery, nothing special there, just a wicket to wicket delivery, Mahmood comes down the track and has a wild swing at it, a typical tail-enders slog, short story shorter - Mahmood misses and Malinga hits, as simple as that
driven down to long-off, gets it wide of the fielder in the deep and the comfortably come back for the second
slightly short and that's pulled away towards deep midwicket for a single
fuller length delivery, Malinga working up good pace here, Plunkett ends up driving it back to the bowler

commentPreTextItems.html: England require another 41 runs with 2 wickets and 18 balls remaining - all but over, one feels!

commentTextItems.html: short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, Plunkett steps forward and goes for the pull, ball zips past the outside edge
worked away on the leg side, easy single to end the over
